title: Notification implicit PendingIntent in com.nextcloud.client allows to access contacts

profile.name: Nextcloud
profile.about: Access, share and protect your files, calendars, contacts, communication & more at home and in your enterprise.

vulnerability_information:
When the victim downloads files in nextcloud.A notification will be triggered. The content of the notification is "Downloaded".This notification is used to remind the user that the download is complete.The pendingintent in this notification is an implicit intent.

At this time a malicious app with "BINDNOTIFICATIONLISTENER_SERVICE" permission can get the pendintent of this notification, because it is an implicit pendintent. Therefore, the malicious app can set the "packageName" and "clipdata" of this pendintent. At this time, the malicious application will inherit the permissions of "com.nextcloud.client".Because nextcloud  has contacts permissions. Therefore, malicious applications can read the contacts without applying for the contacts permission.
{F1262742}
At the same time, because of the path configuration of fileprovider, the log file in the nextcloud app directory can also be read
{F1262743}

The code of this implicit pendingintent is in
"com.owncloud.android.files.services.FileDownloader.notifyDownloadResult(com.owncloud.android.operations.DownloadFileOperation, com.owncloud.android.lib.common.operations.RemoteOperationResult) : void"
{F1262747}

Steps To Reproduce:
packageName:com.nextcloud.client
versionName:3.15.1
phone:pixel3
AndroidVersion:10

1.install and run "poc.apk"
2.click the button to give the "BINDNOTIFICATIONLISTENER_SERVICE" permission to poc
3.install "com.nextcloud.client.apk" and give contacts permission to nextcloud.
4.Download a file as shown in the video.At this time, the victim's app will trigger a notification
5.run "adb logcat | grep sbn". now you can see the contact stolen by the attacker

Supporting Material/References:
1.read contacts poc video
{F1262750}

2.poc.apk
{F1262748}

3."com.nextcloud.client.apk"
{F1262746}

## Impact

Any application with notification permission can steal contacts without apply for the contacts permission
To fix this vulnerability, please set the flag of pengingintent to FLAG_IMMUTABLE

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

Thanks for your report, @qj_test. Much appreciated!

While we are working on verifying this, would it be possible to share a ZIP of the source of the proof of concept APK with us?

For reference, the code snippets referenced above can be found at:

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/b83bf828f2fe24bdf1dc25764c645ec481316f12/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml#L35-L36

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/b83bf828f2fe24bdf1dc25764c645ec481316f12/src/main/res/xml/exposed_filepaths.xml#L1-L14

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/b83bf828f2fe24bdf1dc25764c645ec481316f12/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/files/services/FileDownloader.java#L629-L637

Based on https://github.com/nextcloud/android/search?q=PendingIntent, there are the following usages of pending intents. If you disagree with our assessment, or discover other problematic usages, please do let us know.

# Seems fine
- [x] [`NotificationWork.kt`](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/2f4b1e786102651fd7ac74fcdc3bec17f3e4a9d0/src/main/java/com/nextcloud/client/jobs/NotificationWork.kt#L145-L160). Classname is being set.
- [x] [`DeckApiImpl.java`](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/7a8a08d4ebbb55d0454adb1c4083a23e893a00e3/src/main/java/com/nextcloud/client/integrations/deck/DeckApiImpl.java#L64-L75). Classname is being set.
- [x] [`MediaFoldersDetectionWork.kt`](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/2f4b1e786102651fd7ac74fcdc3bec17f3e4a9d0/src/main/java/com/nextcloud/client/jobs/MediaFoldersDetectionWork.kt#L196). Classname is being set.
- [x] [`PlayerService.kt`](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/2f4b1e786102651fd7ac74fcdc3bec17f3e4a9d0/src/main/java/com/nextcloud/client/media/PlayerService.kt#L102). Classname is being set.
- [x] [`AppNotificationManagerImpl.kt`](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/2f4b1e786102651fd7ac74fcdc3bec17f3e4a9d0/src/main/java/com/nextcloud/client/notifications/AppNotificationManagerImpl.kt#L74). Classname is being set.
- [x] [`FileUploader.java`](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/2d087215deca68a2363559644bb97f6a11736fed/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/files/services/FileUploader.java#L698-L705). Classname is being set.

# Needs further review

- [ ] [`FileSyncAdapter.java`](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/2f4b1e786102651fd7ac74fcdc3bec17f3e4a9d0/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/syncadapter/FileSyncAdapter.java). Classname is not consistently being set.
- [ ] [`FileDownloader.java`](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/e7a79e7f9c538080df277a1172bd06970ea2365d/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/files/services/FileDownloader.java#L585). Classname is not consistently being set.
We've filed a ticket for the engineering team and will let you know once we have more information.
Hi.this is  the source code of the proof

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/e7a79e7f9c538080df277a1172bd06970ea2365d/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/files/services/FileDownloader.java#L585
{F1263472}
Hi.any update?
Hi.any update?
hi.any update? @lukasreschkenc
hi.any update?

Apologies for the delay here. We have chatted to the product team and they were unable to reproduce this issue.

Are there any extra steps needed to reproduce this under 3.15.1 and Android 10?

1.install and run "poc.apk"
2.click the button to give the "BINDNOTIFICATIONLISTENER_SERVICE" permission to poc
3.install "com.nextcloud.client.apk" and give contacts permission to nextcloud.
4.Download a file as shown in the video.At this time, the victim's app will trigger a notification
5.run "adb logcat | grep sbn". now you can see the contact stolen by the attacker

Did you follow the steps I mentioned? First confirm whether the notification is triggered. The exploit must be able to trigger the notification before it can be exploited. Then please execute "adb logcat | grep sbn", take a screenshot and show me the log
hi.any update? @lukasreschkenc
hi.any update? @lukasreschkenc
hi.any update? @lukasreschkenc
hi.any update? @lukasreschkenc
We were able to reproduce this now and will be following up with the product team.

I have followed-up with the team here and they stated that while they are able to reproduce this on 3.15.1, they are unable to do so on the current master daily release.

Are you able to reproduce this on a latest release at https://download.nextcloud.com/android/nightly ?

This is caused by the different package names of the dev version of nextcloud. I checked the code and found that the dev version of nextcloud also has this vulnerability. Because I cannot create an account, please use this poc apk to try it
hi.any update?
We have followed-up with the product team and await their response.
Hi.any update here?
We have unfortunately not yet received an update by the product team.
Hi.any update here?
We have unfortunately not yet received an update by the product team.
Hi.any update here?
Hi.any update here?
hi.any update? @lukasreschkenc
hi.any update? A long time has passed

Thanks a lot for your report again. This has been resolved in our latest maintenance releases and we're working on the advisories at the moment.

If you have a GitHub account please let us know the username, and we will associate it with the advisory.
my Github account is ███

additional_data.new_title: Notification implicit PendingIntent in com.nextcloud.client allows to access contacts

activities.message:
We plan to release public advisories for this issue on April 6th. We've added a draft version of the advisory as summary to this report.

Please let us know if you wish any changes to the advisory.
@nickvergessen I do not want to disclose this report, please close it
It's already disclosed and we can not revert that. Next time you have to react before the automatic deadline so we can cancel it :(
@nickvergessen Please mosaic my github name, I don't want to make this information public
